title: [K-12] Mathematics Problem-Solving Instructional Design Using Cognitive Load Theory and Worked Examples

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary Education-Level Mathematics Knowledge and Teaching Experience
context.additional_context: Advanced mathematics teaching methods training for teachers conducted in a smartphone-based limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can apply instructional design incorporating the worked-example effect when solving complex mathematical problems.
Learners can propose cognitive load management strategies through self-explanation strategies.
Learners can develop problem-solving strategies reflecting cognitive load theory principles in project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
